results.title: This is the ABC
results.creator_credit: Madeleine Williams, Australian National Film Board and Shan Benson
results.brief_description: A survey of Australia’s national radio network and the programs it provides. The network consists of transmitters in the metropolitan areas of the Commonwealth; regional relay transmitters and Radio Australia. The ABC broadcasts a total of 1000 hours of programs every day in the year (1954); various departments compile these programs - News, Sporting, Talks, School Broadcasts etc. The film includes behind-the-scene shots of such programs as Dr Floyd’s Music Lovers’ Hour, Kindergarten of the Air, The Country Hour, Blue Hills and The Village Glee Club. Compered by Rupert Chance.

results.title: This is Tanganyika
results.creator_credit: Film Partnership and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: How Tanganyika has developed in recent years. New hospitals, clinics and technical colleges have been built; mining industries of mineral deposits of lead, copper and golds, have been expanded, and the farmer has learnt new techniques. Shows Dar es Salaam, the capital, the great lakes and rolling savannahs and finally the election of the first Prime Minister, Julius Nyerere.

results.title: This is spinal tap
results.creator_credit: Karen Murphy, Embassy Pictures Corporation (US) and Rob Reiner
results.brief_description: Filmed as a documentary, this satire mimics a serious rock documentary with interviews, concert footage and glimpses of the day to day life of “Spinal Tap”. Christopher Guest, Michael McKean and Harry Shearer star as the band’s members, while Rob Reiner appears as the film maker (Marty Di Bergi). C0-starring Anjelica Huston and Billy Crystal.

results.title: This is Robert
results.creator_credit: L. Joseph Stone, Mary S. Fisher and Vassar College, Dept. of Child study
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Vassar studies: studies of normal personality development”
This film traces the development of an aggressive, “difficult” yet thoroughly appealing child from his early nursery days to his first year at a public school. Clumsy, blundering, confused by varied adult pressures, Robert’s violent and haphazard aggression is seen as a strong, defensive counter-attack on the whole world. His mother’s steadying support and his teachers’ firm consistent and affectionate treatment bring him safely through the first adolescence of the pre-school years to an outwardly smooth adjustment in public school, without his earlier inflammable outbursts.

results.title: This is philosophy
results.creator_credit: Timothy Read, Film Australia, Arch Nicholson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Presents a picture of what philosophy is about, by conveying an impression of the presentation of the subject to university undergraduate students. Designed to enable final year high school students to decide whether to read philosophy at university.
